author: A_Brickset_user
title: Oh yeah!
review: The oldie! The classic! Onua! He is awesome. His mask is superiorly designed. It has the look of a nice, sleek mask and the compatability of a flat boring mask. His arms, like Gali's, are very adjustable, being able to be moved twice at once. His claws are very nice, only there being a flaw that they can easily bend. Lego made a very good decision in this set.

author: Vorahk1Panrahk2
title: An Instant Classic
review:
There is one reason I bought this set, and that is because I had money to due it after returning a duplicated Christmas gift. Okay, so I probably would have still gotten it anyway, but that's not the point. The point is that this set is downright one of the best Bionicle sets to date.

Now to an actual review, which will be based on memories six years old, so bear with me here :P. The canistar is eye catching. It has a very attractive black/dark grey metallic top with holes and a Toa head in it. It also has some stunning can art, with even more information. It has a can code, which was given along with the mask code to unlock information about Onua. There was also can art for the other five Toa. One of the things that makes this can original is that all the artwork is on a separate sleeve that is put around the canistar. It is not a sticker like all the other ones were. This sleeve is meant to turn, and a little window shows you all the masks of the Toa as you turn it. Why that is, I have no clue. It just is. 

After you open the canistar (which you might have trouble with. Took me like ten minutes due to the confusion with the sleeve, lol) a whole assortment of pieces will fall out along with an instruction booklet. The booklet is easy enough to follow, although due to the fact that this Toa is black, it's sort of hard to make out vital details. But it's not too bad. 

There are three key things to this set that make it what it is: The mask, which isn't just a mask like it would be today, but a stunning piece of plastic that gives an incredible compliment to the set. Next up are the claws, which are also very cool, and really gave the guy and earth-Toa feel to him. The last part is the gear system. Those beautiful gear systems now long gone. . .(snif) But anyway, the gear system was great, giving the Toa the ability to look like it was attacking. Combine the gear system with the easy-off mask and you get a pretty entertaining battle mechanism. Now with all the non gear and plus-rod masks, that's virtually impossible. Ahh. . .nostalgia. 

All in all, this is a great classic set, and really stands out with his mask and Toa stature. It's a real shame (and I mean this) that Toa are popping up everywhere, and masks are no longer incredible objects of power that must be obtained to defeat the enemy, but are instead just another tool with no purpose other than to have an extra power. This set is still together after six years, and I still have more fun with him than any of the recent sets combined.

author: Aleiobot
title: Example of awesome year
review: This set is so awesome! With a cool mask, body, and moving arms, this set should be on a BIonicle fan's #1 list! I own this set and wish they still sold this series of Bionicles so I could collect all the Toa!

author: Ovid07
title: Amazing Onua!
review:
This is what Bionicle is all about.  Nowadays there is really no point left what so ever.  In my opinion Bionicle should have been discontinued years ago.

THE GOOD
-For only $7 or so dollars (U.S.), you get about 30 pieces, and a cool can.
-Simple and easy instructions (aren't they all?)
-Lego actually had a neat concept with the first few Bionicles: The Toa of Earth has cool claws to dig with, and looks... well... cool!

THE BAD
Legs are not that possible

The UGLY
None (whew)

OVERALL
A great addition to any Bionicle collection.

author: Porsche911
title: Onua
review: I never really liked Bionicle, IMHO, it brought the quality of Lego sets downhill. I am also very sick of all the new stuff being released and I think that the story is bad. However, the original Bionicles did have good design. This one is especially cool because the gears turn both of his arms so he is "digging". If you have to buy a Bionicle, buy this.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: Looks like my uncle...
review:
Yep... you guessed... it looks like my uncle. The structure, the mask everything looks exactly like my uncle(besides the claws).
Is this guy a hunchback because that's what he looks like. It looks like he is climbing but he has no weapon...he needs one!

author: Blade
title: Toa Onua!
review:
Firstly I want to give some background for the newer LEGO fans. LEGO did away with the Slizers and the Robo Riders at the end of 2000. This was due to this awesome series, Bionicle starting in 2001. The original Bionicle shape totally blew the old Slizer form away looking stronger, more flexible and more human. There is quite an extensive story to Bionicle so if you are interested most of it can be found at www.bioniclestory.com

The quick version goes: On the island of Mata Nui all was well. There were six tribes who lived in six different areas on the island, each filled with small villagers called Matoran, led by a Turaga elder. One day an evil being called Makuta came and cast an evil shadow over the land. He took over with an evil rule and times were dark. A legend spoke of six heroes who would come and restore peace. One day six canisters arrived containing the six heroes. The Toa had almost no memory of their lives before arriving on Mata Nui. To defeat Makuta the will have to find the Great Masks of Power.

Obviously there is allot more to the story but this is the quick version of the first chapter and it would take forever to cover it all. This is about the six first Toa in particular Onua, Toa of Earth. His colour scheme is black and grey. His mask is the Kanohi Pakari, the Great Mask of Strength. His weapons are his claws.

Onua was my first Bionicle and is one of two from the first series that have not one but both of his arms move. The other is Gali (8533). This gives him the ability to tunnel underground with the greatest of ease, when under attack he is ferocious and lightening fast, when on he offensive. He is the shortest of the six, mainly due to his head position and helps with his tunnelling ability. He has a very awesome mask, similar to a hockey mask and always reminds me of Jason from Friday the 13th. 

The Bionicle came in canisters similar to the Robo Riders, but these were fancier with a place on the lid to mount your Toa's masks and a label that slides around the canister revealing different things. Onua's canister is obviously black. It also has a can code, which allowed you to unlock information about Onua from LEGO’s website. Unfortunately the page no longer exists. Also as another person already said the artwork on the canister is quite amazing. The instruction’s quite clear and easy to read and they also have details to build a super Toa from Onua, Pohatu and Tahu (8531 + 8534) over the three instruction books.

I cannot find any faults with this Bionicle and after all these years, allot of rough play, the joints and gear system are still strong. The only real issue in play I had was the head and or Mask came off a bit easily during a fight.

Overall this Bionicle was an excellent one to get, he got me into the series and added so much to my play, to finish the play could have been a weeks worth of free time as a kid. Like all Bionicle he isn't any fun by himself but once added with one other figure it goes right up and keeps getting better until you have them all. His aesthetics are great for the day he was made and I feel he is about a 9/10 or Almost Perfect, as he has it all going for him but needed that bit more to get to 10. If you a Bionicle fan you need to start from the beginning and this is the beginning. A good one for people who are robot fans too.

author: Gus_263
title: Awesome toa of earth
review: A classic toa of earth, having a dark gray with black as colors. A good mask is the pakari, the arms are useless in some sets, but in anothers with gear systems, are too usable like onua, that can move the two arms. The claws are very usable, in small sets, or in the greater as various things. The eyes are dark green.

author: legoguy2805
title: Toa Mata of Earth
review:
I have recently got this off Bricklink for £3.50. Like Gali, When you turn the cog on the back both arms move up and down.

Pros:
Claws
Kanohi Pakari, Mask of Strength
One of the first series of bionicles to be released
Very poseable
Stands up well

Cons:
Mask falls off easily

Overall, 5/5

author: buzzandwoody2000
title: Toa Onua, The spirit of Stone
review:
As my 2nd Toa Mata, Onua is a very cool Bioicle to be
a great Toa. The Toa Mata WERE the best Toa ever MADE.
Onua has a very cool canster as said. As the best cansters ever made, I just love that twist tube system. As now, I am very glad I got mine free. A friend gave me the sets Tahu,Ouna,and a buch more. 
and that's it for now,
buzzandwoody2000

author: SaintElsewhere
title: Amazing
review: I got this set for my sixth or seventh birthday and I still remember putting it together in front of the fridge. The early Bionicles were some of the coolest ever made, I just wish I got more. :( My favourite parts of this set are Onua's claws and mask. They are very quaint and simple compared to modern Lego. I also like the gear to move the arms and the fully poseable legs. Thank god I still have most of the pieces. (Only thing that's missing is the mechanism to move the arms.)

author: Yoda____
title: My first bionicle
review: Why can't all bionicles be like this. It's simple but good. The pieces look great and sometimes i just looked at individual ones and they looked awesome. Such a promising start to the bionicle series. This wasn't just lego considering it had a cool function it could have just been a toy without building.

author: Kalhiki
title: The Hunchback of Onu-Wahi
review:
I like him. He has a lot of personality and is just great. I really don't know where else to go.
BUILDING EXPERIENCE
There wasn't anything new or different. I mean, his head connects a different way than the other Mata, and he does have the gear function, but other than that there isn't much.
PARTS
Parts are good. This section is mainly for MoCists, but in this set you get a Mata body, Pakari, Claws and some other old/rare parts. So if you bought him for the pieces, I think you'll be happy. Plus, black can be incorporated into almost any model.
PLAYABILITY/POSEABILITY
Poseability... Well, no neck, elbows, wrists or knees, so he has less than your average Mata. He also can't move outward at the shoulders nor can he move forward or back at the hips unless you remove the leg at the axle. Playability is good. Turn the gear on his back and you get his "digging action". His arms move up and down (One up one down). For this gimmick, the lack of elbows is actually good as it makes the arms sturdier. His mask is also loosely fitting. I mean, it stays on well, but it can be knocked off. This is for the whole deal with if you have a Rahi you can have them battle and try to knock the other's mask off. It's a nice play feature, but just be careful not to loose the mask never to be found again.
OVERALL AND VALUE
I think he's worth your money. He's fun to play with, and is a good display piece. Since you can't get this guy in stores anymore, You'll have to find him online. I recommend paying up to around eight dollars for him, but since he isn't being sold anymore, maybe a little more would be okay.

author: jackaroo
title: All have moving arms, they combine to make two huge bionicles.....got to be the best bionicles i've bought so far!
review: I first bought the graphic novels for these bionicles for my son and was praying one day i would find the figures and i did. Thank god for ebay!! Firstly, all the figures have moving arms BUT when combined they make two huge bionicles with moving legs.  How cool is that!!

author: blazetrooper501
title: 8532 Onua
review:
I got this set recently and I think it is awsome. Onua is the Toa of earth now I will go over the canister.

The canister is pretty cool in the bionicle story these are the canister's that the Toa arrived on Mata Nui in. On the canister it shows Onua in a cool pose and he is underground tunneling with his huge claws. On the top of the canister it has a face of a Toa wich if you want you could put the mask on top of it. So the canister is cool it's very accurate to the story.

The figure

Toa Onua is a cool figure himself since he was one of the first Bionicles to come out he is short but still a great figure. He has a knob on his back which if you turn it his claws will start swinging. He has good detail he looks cool with his black and gray color scheme.

The build was very easy but still fun he has a green piece that go's in the back of his head wich gives him green eye's.

Overall I think he is a great a great addition to anyones collection and he is a classic. I give him a 5/5.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Mata) - Onua Review
review:
This is a nice figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 30 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 49 pieces and it was 7 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 23 cents per piece which is a really good value for a figure like this.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't have to complain about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8532-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the legs and the feet can be moved. On the back of the torso is a gear which you can use to move both arms which have some really cool claws. I really like the design of this figure and I also like the mask which comes with this set.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1

Stopmotion 2

Review

author: blaksamu12
title: Toa Mata Onua
review:
Onua is a super cool Toa Mata.  I got him on ebay $8.50.  Out of the five I have, he is my favorite, besides Tahu.

 

Like all the Toa Mata, an easy but fun building experience.  He is exactly like Gali's build, but the piece that connects his head to his body is different, and put lower.  The way you put his head on makes him a hunchback, but looks cool and is different from the other Toa.  The parts are good, not the greatest for MOCing, though, because there is only 30 pieces (the least out of the Toa Mata).  Onua also has great playability.  His function is more realistic than Tahu's, because his fuction is making the claws go up and down.  His "Clawing" function would be good against enemies.

 

His original price was excellent.  $8.00 is very good since you get an Onua poster with all the 2001 sets on the back, directions, the cool figure, and an awesome canister.  If you can get him on ebay for $10.00 or less, you're getting a good deal.  Overall, my second favorite of the Toa Mata, behind Tahu.  I highly recommend you get Toa Onua Mata.  10/10.

 

:{)

author: Odeinoichus
title: Onua, The Menacing Toa
review:
Set #8532 Onua: This Toa is very menacing looking with his frightening mask and his clawed hands, but he's really not that bad.

 

Onua used two geared pieces so that both arms could move in tandem and strike at the evil followers of Makuta. His model was built using the same standard pieces found in early Bionicle sets, the only unique piece was his mask. His coloring was a nice blend of blacks and greys and I especially liked the fact that you could attach his hands any way you saw fit. He could claw downwards, claw upwards or just have his hands out sideways to grab someone in a tight grip and hurl them away.

 

Overall I'd have to recommend all six original Toa to any Bionicle collectors. Their parts are also quite nice for any kind of building you'd prefer if you aren't a super fan of the original model's design. Improvisation is the key with Bionicle Toa or what have you.

author: tkettle9719
title: 10 years ago...
review:
I changed my life by getting this little set for $5 at a Tuesday Morning. It was my very first set, and I was amazed by how much it looked like a little robot. I still have it in a relatively good condition, everything working fine.

Pros

  • -This was my first set ever, and the claw rip function was extremely exciting then.
  • -For almost 30 pieces, you get a nice product, with many good and useful Technic pieces.
  • …

Cons

  • -The set itself does seem just a little short in length for regular  pricing.
  • -The only Technic pieces here seem to be gears and axles, which is disappointing as it goes under the Technic line.
  • …

Overall, this set is still revolutionary in my mind; with Bionicle, there was now wide piece diversity, making newer sets what they are today. Forever will I have this set, and treasure it.

author: Zatth
title: Onua Mata: First of the Bunch!
review:
Ever since I became a big fan of bonicle in 2004, my favorite Elemental power was earth. It still is. I just fell for the Earth bionicles, with their hunched looks and dark green eyes. As Onua was the first Earth Toa, I always viewed him (in Mata form) as my dream vintage set.

Thus, I was ecstatic when my brother got him for me for Christmas this year.
So nostalgic.....

Onua has a fun, unique build. Typical of Earth Toa, he is hunched and shorter, with his head being on a lower level. He is also exclusively black and dark grey, except for the wonderfully contrasting dark green eyes. The building experience was fun, it's very exciting to see those pieces come together, especially the gears. The build is also quite quick.

As for playability, Onua is superb. (At least if he's taking on opponents his size.) The main attraction for his playability is his gear feature. As many before me have said, these gear features were not gimmicky, instead they were quite fun and as the original Toa were smaller they added a great deal more playability in that respect. Onua's gear action causes his clawed arms to swing up and down alternately, which is very satisfying to do. He can rip through just about any enemy you put in front of him. (Or at least it feels like he could.) He is also terrific for scaling cliff walls.

Just one con in this great set: His size. Continuous with the nature of bionicles during 2001, Onua is smaller than many later sets. Naturally, this does mean that compared to other Toa he has low levels of articulation and is hard to truly pose.

Do not be deterred by this. If you love the Element Earth, if you love old bionicles, if you want a piece of lego history - get this set. You won't be disappointed, and you'll probably be pleased! Cheers!

author: DDenissssss
title: True Bionicle
review: I got this set when I was 6. It was cheap but very interesting. This is my first Bionicle and my favourite. The box had pictures of all Toa Mata, short instruction and history of appearance of Toa. At the top you have a head for mask and 6 places for Toa heads. The construction is easy but strong enough. First Toa and especially their masks have incredible design and each mask has a secret code inside. Later I got a CD where you type the code in and then you watch a video about Toa, but unfortunately lost Onua's black mask (then found it), got the code from Nui-Jaga. Also, you can build a Toa Kahita - combo from 3 toa.
